content: when  you don’t want to be sad when there’s no way to stop when  someone else holds it  your heart

title: Worth It
content: never a let down surprising in every way gentle blade in heart

title: peace
content: we suffer for it peace an illusion to us deserve no quarter

title: Cardiac Condition
content: He had an enlarged heart— I thought it was from his love. Turns out, it was the burgers.  But it taught me: There's no limit to how many people you can love— or burgers.

title: Last Bastion
content: A castle called my heart was sieged Torches and arrows, burning yet piercing As a single fist beat at the drawbridge She stood upon water, a miracle calling Asking it to stop, but all it knew how to do; Beat back, pleading to a song of longing

title: you don't know me but
content: i wanted to tell you i love you but it seemed a bit too forward see, we haven’t met and  i don't know you as much as i’d like to, it seems the cat is out of the hat and Dr. Seuss only wrote imaginary things and  nothing of reality

title: miles afloat
content: and for your worries so what that jazz carries blue ferries across a black sea eyes close for that dream  Written to  Miles Davis - So What

title: Piercing
content: It was hollow—zero gauge. Out dropped the flesh, a cylinder of myself, geometric, mirroring insecurities.  Cosmetic ambivalence, a freak from birth.

title: Figurative Greetings
content: Nestled, near a vibrant Heart  Melodic, afar a beat that Carries  Sheets, hold music waving Notes  Words, give poetry greetings Forever

title: Untested Hypothesis
content: As I counted the moles, I weighed the compounds of my heart— molecularized in a pyroclastic event, a few elements short of fusion.  Yet she burned like the sun, whether it was physics or chemistry, I know not the results.  But I brought my lab coat and goggles, just in case.

title: Lithic Conservator
content: Trepidation was due, down came the slew— a landslide of destruction, deconstructing a heart.  Lithostatic pressure shards, pieces eject in jagged parts.  Hands held sharp, catch bruised chunks as they tumble, breaking apart.

title: peter panic
content: as i age, my mind feels younger time passes strangely, but my body it tells me lies, it causes me pain mocking me, whispering "old" i begin to pout and shake my fists throwing myself onto the ground— but it will never be true!

title: ex-wife
content: she said he had a pretty smile—must be why she had his child

title: expectations
content: quiet inflection yet expecting reflections shattered winter snow

title: Moving On Myth
content: Her eyes, clouded, brimming— a cup overflowing. My words, though worn, let me try once more: the tears return, but the thoughts never fade, a heart beating never stills— a stubborn pulse remains.  Written to  GoGo Penguin - Hopopono

title: what a chore
content: it would be a good day to dance but when is it not, so why are you not dancing? what’s your excuse no partner? we have nothing to lose so why not let it out and foot loose seems she has laundry to do  Written to  Glen Miller - In the Mood

title: muskisms
content: king of the rocket ships, thrusters of bluster, fueling dreams on vaporous claims— had you but asked, we, the people, would have gathered, a cosmic force, to simply throw you at mars, arms raised—not in awe, but in relief.

title: visceral vase
content: and without thought, stopped interjected by music, enthralled by memories categorically trying to close off my emotions focusing with intensity to task to make write what was undone for my words are mine alone and i stand strong not but a man, banalities, a human, flesh and heart more than the moment passed, beyond judgment as none should be so frail to let them cut you emboldened and brazened by the tempered life lived and at the end when everything is broken i ask but once more shatter me again, so i can feel  Written to  Eternal Eclipse - Hidden Machines

title: metaphorically
content: how do i explain the infinite, how can i write and mean it? the truth in my heart is miles apart from anyone i've ever met, it seems.  i've traveled and i've traveled, but in a moment— someone struck me, and suddenly, it became everything.  metaphorically.

title: Becoming art
content: It’s a favor, a splatter, a finding, a pattern:  particles.   Ask, and you’ll be all that matters— matter.   A life‐changing sequence of events:  time.   What prevents abstract probabilities from  existence?

title: claymore
content: face claymore forward careful with the blasting cap aim it at my heart

title: pruned flower
content: a body left undiscovered, untouched in its beauty perfect, without a hand to harm.  but touch was not gentle; a scorned and wounded heart, a body left broken inside, where the scars never fade.

title: boldness in blue
content: a bold flash of blue, kingfisher of burning words, hearts bled in her wake.

title: ash and smolders
content: left in ash: smolders written across walls with time hearts burned in her wake

title: Picture
content: Positively Insane Creations Twisting Unreal Realities’ Edges

title: shut up and smile
content: i like teeth but not mouths. not the noises certain people make, or the absence of hygiene.

title: bop bag
content: my heart keeps getting knocked down without thinking, it bounces back up— a bop bag.  not a toy, yet I let them play on.

title: gentle rage
content: brightly dreamt meadow light drifts slow into darkness— hints of violence.

title: blowhard
content: blowing into embers fanning flames when ice became water puckered lips finally kissed pursing to quench desire

title: reason is losing
content: i awoke in a nightmare to reflections screaming back at me, no agreement, only chaos. people were dying, yet they minted crypto— self-enrichment and strife. bloated egos waged onslaught, a war against sanity.  they were winning.

title: robbed of identity
content: i see tyranny, or is it tears?  for my country.  it's been robbed of dignity, fed madness.  this is world war three we swore: never again. and my heart weeps for all of us, but most of all,  for my country.

title: uncut
content: a lawn, unbroken emerald blades dew glisten mower’s teeth falter

title: true nature
content: grabbed by collar, trodded by squaller, groveling for dollars, and spare change; to make cents of life. having been told, beautiful, you found it, a lie.  now soaked in bitterness, polluted by capitalist, where is your true nature?

title: if i had a mirror
content: to the most ridiculous person i know: myself. there is no prize, nor an award for this— and if anything, perhaps you should slap yourself.

title: sweet nothings
content: drizzled distillate sweet concocted confection flushed by clear waters

title: high marks
content: what if the words were love themselves, each one capable of endless combinations  how would you know the best arrangement and if you found belonging, would you still question  without making marks, as if to make a point

title: of passion
content: once asked what of passion or romance and the embrace, i restrain such imagery but if i had to— my existence would be known with pressure.  from every limber finger pressing upon skin, imbuing a lifetime of emotions in invocation.  a lingering touch leading to dew on petals, a flower not forgotten with a fiery heart.  with deep reverence and focus, the madness of metaphor ensuing, pleasured yearnings in panting sounds—  a quiver or a whisper, a cry and a plea, an ode to euphoria.

title: flat fields
content: flat feasting planet shepherded fields grow devout eggplant rots within

title: sondering sways
content: sonder over yonder, precipice has me kicking my feet.  and how i ponder this view, not to be squandered—  quite the scene, refrain. give me your hand, no need to lean, let’s just sit together, have a swing, swaying on heartstrings.

title: check your agenda
content: better check your agenda, because i'm pointing fingers.  always the scoundrel, out for my pound of flesh.  i see the politicians and the ceo’s— itching—who's next?  civil hands poised to start the party, eat the rich, anarchy.

title: cryonic cash
content: severed heads for future endeavors, wired to robots pulling levers.  i see the future—it’s looking better; i’m not in it, but know the weather.  the tides to come, the cost to be— money buys your immortality.  cryonic freezing our history— as if decay’s worth repeating.

title: seven seas
content: as i pour my essence, it’s served me well— been pleasant, with patience.  subtle pleas, everlasting seas— the ocean of my heart, yours to see.

title: of success and purpose
content: i do not know what work is yet, i also do not know what work life balance is i find myself in perpetual motion

title: of your place in the universe
content: wherever you are is exactly where you are supposed to be without you there, the universe itself would not exist as it does

title: of the heart
content: while easy to close off, keeping it open— allowing it to suffer— offers a greater beauty, even if painful.

title: of family
content: always remember: share the love that let you share your name.

title: of politics
content: be ungovernable

title: of patriotism
content: feed the machine of your choosing— service through action is better than inaction.

title: maple
content: wrapped in rings, constantly bound, a pressure encircling, marking each passing year.  tapped during winter for my very blood— the needle runs deep, and out draws the ink.  i am but a bastion of sap, on tap for your delight. stick out your tongue and have but a taste.

title: of money
content: while never part of good solutions, it exists to present the illusion of progress.  i have not been able to think of a better measure by which man agrees to trade.  i’ve seen enough strife  to willingly give mine away.  i hope to die  with empty pockets.

title: varnished judgement
content: on another knot, like a bump on a log, jammed upstream— band saws ablaze, milling the edges, creating furniture,  beauty passes.  please, take a seat.  i’ve been waiting, polished and complete, only to pass judgment— like carved out oak, hollow beneath.

title: soaked in worry
content: bathtub of brevity, lend me some levity, for these are troubling times.  i need to steep, to tender the sinew— for i've had to protect my heart from harsh realities.  so let me soak just a little longer, perhaps until pruned.

title: whoops
content: you utter failure, not even a hole poked— just faulty.  you were supposed to protect me!  but you were just a condom. it was supposed to be love. they broke up— just like you, creased and leathered, too.  and here i am, whoops.

title: puzzle pieces
content: traveling in troves of sections, missing a p for reflections. instead, it came in pieces and lessons— taught by life and repressions.  open once, but no longer electing to participate with such intersections. pieces of pie divided, no longer a collection.

title: nexus
content: it was a twist of fate gone skyrmions, writing a new reality into a nexus, caught in plasmatic magnetism, fields of stirred ions, blasting away, into dissipation—  a manifold in space, a platter, forever spinning, trapped in its endless place.

title: shame
content: ashamed— not of who i am, but what we’ve come to mean. now i’m searching for new work, finding my way out of the machine.

title: bye
content: bitter yearnings end

title: of dancing
content: it's never too late to learn how  and if you aren't why not?

title: of meanness
content: it's a reflex, sharp and certain, never gaining you a thing.  practiced long, it carves you hollow, stealing more than it can bring.

title: selling our souls
content: when a country prioritizes capitalism over order, would you expect anything less?  democracy clearly has a price— and we have all been bought out.

title: armed armistice
content: roman pilgrimage, phyllary protects pistil, petals rise with swords.

title: beautiful monsters
content: looking in two of your eyes, imagining there's three— because being interesting is more important than being pretty.  so why don't you see? i'm tired of pretentious pageantry.  use your brain, or you mean nothing to me.

title: donuts are messy
content: i once was a donut, resting upon a couch, eating pizza— without any mouth.  and as it passed through, it fell down, where it went, who knows— never to be found.  so i drank a beer, it’s all over me now. just a soggy mess— a hole with no regrets.

title: barren bears
content: breaking through thin ice polar bears drift, shadows bloom spring vines twist below

title: stair climbs
content: stairs or a ladder, does the angle of attack matter? climb’s are a jaunt, an affair of wants.  and once at the top, did you find what you hoped, or did you feel grounded, seeing what surrounds?

title: of singing
content: then thousand hour rule always applies do it as often as life allows

title: beautiful inability
content: my sheer inability to temper my emotions is both the most beautiful and maddening thing to ever experience.

title: whoops
content: you utter failure, not even a hole poked— just faulty.  you were supposed to protect me!  but you were just a condom. it was supposed to be love.  they broke up— just like you, creased and leathered, too.  and here i am, whoops.

title: better not be thoreau
content: a thoreau affair over, thoroughly drawn out— character to page in heavy lettering, stained black, an unlit tunnel, an abysmal thoroughfare

title: prompted by weather
content: weathering the weather, whether or not wanted, i fell upon downfalls, long since trodden— perhaps by horse and drawn carriage, chunks of pumpkin shouting proposals, hoping for marriage.

title: a true visionary
content: she made a spectacle, looking through a reticle.  i found it incredible— perhaps she was credible in her field of vision.

title: population control
content: a population bound, no education found. pledge allegiance to a flag’s empty call, guised virtue’s bitter gall.  walk in line, no path to tread, schooled to silence, voices left unsaid. steady supply for elders' hungry maw, we simply obey, the price we blindly draw.

title: axels
content: cyclonic axels billy mays pushing cocaine white powder fractals

title: pardon my fuck
content: black side of the moon,  pink-stained views— but all in all, reality has let me down.  there’s no moon, no sun, no frown— just abject fucking horror, unless we tear it all down, shoving the bricks down authoritarian mouths.

title: spotless
content: she wiped the grief off my lips, supple fingertips—a thief.  lacking fingerprints, leaving no mark, denying any start— yet at the end, she stole my heart.

title: the doe
content: fawning fawn of innocence, plight upon your highness' heart, prancing on precipitous paths, dew-lathered petals of my soul, struck by sheer magnificence.

title: but a dream
content: having seen this in a dream before, serendipitous turned precipitous.  splendor unbridled in a heart, through pacing, setting itself apart.  and i woke, remembering only light— a whisper still reflected off the moon at night.

title: cowtow
content: inhale and then plead, clinging upon edge and brink, beyond the release.

title: of shelter
content: come within my cradle, feel a heart near— every beat, yours.  a boundless existence, spent in the rhythm of your happiness.

title: it doesn't have to make sense
content: smiles in the air, lingering in my eyes— tears of happiness.  the world still shines, it lingers, it carries, it pines. i reminisce— no relents, no pretense, the journey needs no reason.

title: tendered tender
content: flattering stacked cash, monetizing moments, a note written in a telling for a teller’s dwelling.  no time for spare change, she had a job to do— breaking his money into pieces he could understand, counting them back, slow and cold.

title: pause
content: a candle, a moment of modesty— dancing, casting shadows honestly. the dance was soft, with gentle lips, near a tender kiss—you blew me out. and while the smoke lingers, pause... reminisce.

title: miss fortune
content: where there should be sorrow a grin sneaks across his face secretly holding a connection evoked, reflecting moments tender his capitalist nature richness because of your existence needing not money but your attention an affection of the mind, one without you he will never again find

title: undertow
content: there is a bottle, in it lies the sea, filled to the cork, stirring memory.  a ship within, masts in despair, tempests rage— yet the cork’s not there.  with one swift pop, the waves rush free, out spills my ink, swallowing me.

title: liberation in motion
content: beyond words, a hope— liberations of magnificence.  enigmatic scaffolds mask a masterpiece in motion.  not for tourists, but for those who see.

title: simple reasons
content: i wanted to say you’re beautiful— but what do i mean?  i wanted to say you’re incredible— but more importantly, thank you.  whatever the reason, whatever the meaning— these feelings define why we live.

title: have fun
content: existence became purpose, effort unending, drawn from the universe. he cared for it, as it cared for him— a quiet madness, yet nothing mattered.  life, a spectacle of choice, lines existed, yet he colored beyond. smiling endlessly, bound by nothing, each moment—his, each one, fun.

title: sealed fate
content: can you wonder upon penance of vengeance undone— one to the next, entwined, now one, unbreakable.  no flinching from either side, not a single blink— yet i yearn to look into those eyes.  and how, in memory, these feelings rise, a new dawn stirring— my fingertips type elations, no longer hurt.  but does it matter? to linger without intent, to read without relent, to dream in ways i shouldn’t.  now, i must remember— keep that door shut, and behind me.

title: keynote
content: cobbled carbuncle, knobbling modularly, villous volume, contiguous curls— bundled beauty, a keynote tucked in the frunk, forgotten, or not?

title: flaxen hues
content: flaxen seedlings, granular gleams, rime ringings on hollow beams. cored frost, cracked ice, kniff-knaff shards skitter—alight, alight.

title: awnings
content: angling beats; reach, yawn sprawling arms, wake, a new dawn stretched lips smile in awe

title: in your net
content: fishnets and sweet lace, a net of legginess, lengthened by great heights.  never had i imagined a force so domineering— only to realize i had been caught.  yet just a man, no pittance needed— deconstruct me, and have your way.

title: pass it along
content: if i weren’t here tomorrow, i’d wish for a smile.  can a wish carry on without existence?  perhaps—if you pass it along.

title: empire
content: fallen empire of lost longings, kind words in search— where is the tenderness? not in the rubble.  soft souls bellow, below hardened husks.

title: brewings
content: let ignus ignite the flame— flight, fight—oxygen, acetylene. molten metal, cauldron seething, caustic will—a true witch’s brew.

title: she's got powers
content: infective, reflexive, reflective shining, bouncing off surfaces and sections pieces of hearts, resonant intentions trying to find common ground, a reason to sound no unmoored emotions, no reckless descent still waters whisper—calm, yet immense

title: of realities
content: i have a wife—she knows i write poetry, and she knows much of it is for another. my transparency is not a confession, but a refusal to intentionally lie.  i am imperfect, but truth is the only way to face what is real.

title: combustion engine
content: motoring through, pistons on stroke, rods in motion, timing precise. angling actions, torque in translation, bores driven deep through crankshaft bends. gears interlocking, traction engaging, combustion igniting— one hell of a ride.

title: tasty drops
content: give her a scalpel or a knife, an angry tongue tasting inside. cutting deep, but thoughtful cuts— record slides, a slice of love.  dropping what I’m picking up, as the music plays, she waits— for the song to end, or the drop to take.

title: more than words
content: sharing an image, a word we define, together we pieced a memory in time.  stitched so neatly, it feels divine— so i ask, won’t you find it in your heart to forgive? let more than memory live.  for it feels like death inside, i miss you beyond my words, even as i write them—line by line.  repetitious, infectious, this nature of mine— you might decline, but i repeat and rhyme, continue, refine, plead upon a universe of melodies.  more than threads, more than strings— impacts with meaning, contemplations seething, writhing.  without you, it feels like knives inside of me, and though i never cease, i hope you believe— these are real feelings, not just words.

title: singularity
content: and how i long for longing, beyond definition, stretched past the seams of existence itself. it tests the very fabric inside me, pulling, pushing—beyond my capability, incapable of letting go. words flow, like rivers carved by blade, sharp with cunning wordplay, tremulous in verse. heartstrings play, a melody that cuts, a curse—stricken, sickened by a singular nature: hers.

title: bend, don't break
content: reaching for some peace, shelter to understand loss, buckled, yet steadfast.

title: healers hidden dwelling
content: healers hidden dwelling, inside a tree, nestling.  and as it reaches, it pleas, grasping— sweet sap of melody, playing notes of growth and positivity.  dripping creative beauty and diversity, fighting the strife of today's homogeny.

title: babylon
content: dune eden, to propagate promptitude, interlude—saga of life.  grass from rains, tears from strife, complex conditions, ever rife.

title: congested hearts
content: arteries of failure, chasing dreams—capitalism. capitulation, lapping dances, dollars draped in attire iterations. stylistic nihilism, a critique of criticisms.

title: open tabs
content: i pull up a tab, start to write— it’s not much of a stretch.  i lost my grip long ago, extended fingertips— but when i think of you, they reach for lips,  perhaps something more seductive. but i hesitate to get reductive, for there's so much more to you than your biology.

title: of neatness
content: thriving in chaos you only appear neat when it's a pretense needed for others however, being a complete mess  never feels good either like all things, pick your battles

title: of lies
content: the best ones  are the ones we tell ourselves the ones we don't realize until it's too late  the rest are factually quite terrible

title: of dreams
content: the scariest ones are those you can make real— because once you succeed, you start to believe any of them can be.

title: going native
content: riding a buffalo, tilted and apexed, hooves hit the earth, yellowstone flexed.  lakes ripple glass, horns redirect, charging the tourists, calling collect.  i flip my penny, but no penance yet.  Written to:  Swatkins - Until I Get Back

title: of cruelty
content: perhaps i have lost the meaning of cruelty, having found beauty in every affliction. but never have i intended to be, and i would carve out my own heart— if only to prove i still feel.

title: trenched in
content: an opaque box, chained and weighted, cast from the stern, forgotten.  sinking, sinking— mariana trench deep.  and still, these emotions rest inside, just as immense  as the pressure surrounding.

title: bitten
content: and in battle, i face my enemy— the emotion before me, unrelenting, without reason.  when thought beaten, it feigns death, lurking, waiting—like lycanthropy, howling at the moon, infectious, consuming.  only to wake,  marked and confused, covered in ink

title: surges
content: can it not be both— love and impossible?  if i hold back the tide, will you ride the crest?  for when we sync, like two colliding waves, our apex doubles, surging.

title: and let me be sorry
content: but for a few more times, these feelings are alive— if only for a moment, to remind me you’re quite special, even if just in my mind.

title: meltdown
content: sploshing in my thoughts, trodden in my depths, facing collapse.  pizza pulls my flesh, toppings overlap— causation and collapse, as sauce boils to the surface, an ooey, gooey mess.

title: bedridden
content: dangled below tongue, rested until done. and when pulled out, the mercury rose—  definitely sick of this situation. or just a fever that never broke?

title: heart you
content: the chilled air fills the car, but my heart stays warm with youth. when they meet—cold-sparked, bedazzled breath— a frost filmed canvas forms upon the glass.  i draw a heart. it's for you

title: Refuse Silence
content: if Democracy isn’t for sale, why does it feel bought?  what did we fight for if we sign away our will?  it’s time to rise, break the chains, and reclaim the pen. Democracy lives where we the people Refuse Silence.

title: sumerian session
content: drunk on ninkasi blessings entered the lugal estate hoped to teach power a lesson  thoughtful thief, hands on a bronzed vessel breathing smoke, letting out a low whistle  golden art, a heart molten gemmed, fate stolen, guarded, left with no eyes, no hands, dearly departed

title: appetizing angle
content: on fractals of indifference a kaleidoscope of remembrance tilts just right—vision ignites, your beauty burning through  fragmented features, curvaceous creatures, a monster of memory— still, how i long to be devoured

title: false starts
content: delicate rises, swollen on self-reflection, arrives deflated.

title: metamorphisocial
content: carrion— a caterpillar capriciously legged in unknitted strands, clavicle-like knackering of jointed butteries, oiling biomechanical skitterings,  scattering litterings of fingerlings, deploying like catastrophes— it butterflied into a bluesky.

title: pointed fencing
content: and while hoping for a riposte, the touché felt delectable, en garde through the exchange, a flèche of unyielding glory, no room to disengage, every move—but never a feint.

title: dreamcaught
content: closing— is it my eyes or my heart? i see you, even with both shut.  woven in a dream, intersecting my thoughts, a dreamcatcher reflecting back upon myself.  and as i wake, what lingers is not the memory— but the reality you left in light.

title: her mind
content: her mind - a storm reshaping the sky

title: captivated
content: never have i been so captivated by the manifestation of another's intelligence.  it's the most beautiful thing.

title: set me on fire
content: no grievance stirs, not even a whisper; no tears remain—none left to shed.  i reap each reason for fragile possibilities, then float between these wavering reveries.  and in my pocket, lint waits, hoping for a spark.

title: SR72
content: runway fuel coated blackbird rocketing forward the earth and air bend

title: hawthorn
content: safehaven of forlorn fragrance, often wept for as the barometer quakes, the leaves take their licks oh, but a thorn leaves far more than a kiss this heart's sacred remedy once again amiss

title: biting weather
content: pedaling petals off a floral ride, one of longing as the winter arrives. it seems to come, time after time— i now realize, like the seasons, part of her nature where a cool breeze doesn't just howl, it bites.

title: balloon
content: gripping a can-opener, the box was hard to cut. spinning a handle, I looked aloon. who uses such words? one who babbles upon brooks, allusions of stolen pollen. that B went missing, and the L floated away— too much to make of in a single moment.

title: my volume
content: the cathartic nature of an infantile man, swaddled in elations of elevated heights. a mind self-provisioned, improvised, signing treaties with palpitations unwise. but within the depths of the pages, their voluminous nature would be realized.

title: climb in
content: in the trunk, he found relief, folding into shadow, outside on leaves. soft steps traced his quiet release, in the keys left in locks he picked, the boils of wells left to fester, he sought blood, yet craved ink. his fingers glided, fevered, aching— a fleeting gesture—come near.

title: gemmed
content: arctic gale howls my name into the void i wisp, more than myth freezing in memory, bound yet unbroken time and space fracture under weight a waiting gem gleams in that place— even if only but a fragment of a heart beyond grace

title: sweet dreams
content: slippers sliding happily rabbit ears dangling merrily and the smile that beckons a thing of my dreams i happen to be wearing pajamas forgive me for not being my best it'd be nice to get some rest so if you would, please gently tuck me to sleep and nestle in my arms a heart by which to keep  Written to -  Keeper

title: lit fuse
content: travels of a fuse goes a flittering lit muse exploding my heart

title: you are my heart attack
content: infectious, complex inflections tingle through walls, imbalanced arteries under attack. it ruptures—i collapse, falling forward, leaning back, this emotion takes me for a ride, so overwhelming, it nearly takes my life.

title: plastic prompt
content: plastic collides—pitted, worn indecisions riddle, deformed pelting percussive pellets, polystyrene alchemy.  a brittle heart, cracked and caving, recycled cavity—carve it out. landfill is what becomes of me.

title: bottomless vessel
content: cowardly frights, ghostly flights spirits ignite in glassware whispers glistening shadows in reflective meadows a tale takes shape in deep-hearted bellows more than a song—an incantation, a call to belong from the vessel’s hallows it echoes.

title: waiting for tomorrow
content: inward shapes, arms crossed legs up, head back—weightless, inverted restless wrestlings with quiet feelings tracing meanings in words and ceilings drifting to the rhythm of our hearts eyes closed, simply waiting for tomorrow.

title: into the grey
content: out of the water, into the cold where depths held emotions untold. once they were wept, the lake took shape, tears carving echoes of what remained. long ago, washed ashore, a memory rose and walked away— haunting, adrift in the snow, into the grey.

title: ice fishing
content: stricken, brittle and frail a wicked cold blew barren and pale upon bone, he cast into ice no hole, no bait, no line to entice the season had passed, no license, no meal long a criminal, longing to steal he crouched, he watched, he fought to feel the distance called, but so did his hunger

title: dearly departed
content: knitted during mortuary services, a kindred sweater draped her frame. she sat alone, wrapped in reverence, a warmth no longer bestowed. she gave a piece of her heart, not in grief, not in guilt— but because it was best.  they had parted long ago, the weather brisk but never bitter.

title: unyielding
content: intricate fillings, fruits soaked in sugar, boiled, refined, wrapped in delicate folds. a pastry of meaning, rich and pungent, harvested from the fields of her heart. but to spare future yields, the crops were left, the hands that once tended—now rusted and brittle.

title: blood lines
content: bloodlines drawn, a pentagram carved in ritual nation. subservient to strife and coin, a bird of freedom, tarred and feathered. a global joke, the bitter truth standing on a pedestal of destruction the old and rich still crack the whip.

title: doppelgänger
content: recently, i saw a doppelgänger. mentioning it, maybe to their frustration— no one likes to be observed without a purpose, without a word. and being a twin means little beyond vanity.

title: extend
content: private spaces thrown extend, release the unknown— love erupts unbound.

title: intersections
content: an intersection in time— crossroads of crossed lines, a spark ignites, chaos swells. flames rise, flames fall, and death, inevitable, lingers. but fire never truly dies— passion feeds the embers, whether in history or our hearts.

title: hidden from truths
content: there's nothing in my mind holding me back, pinning me down to that time, that place, that space. vitriol bleeds, and still my eyes weep— you sew what you reap, and these threads are mine to keep.  my quilt, my scribe, my shelter of light, where, with a humble flashlight, i hide.  Written to:  Taking Back Sunday - Cute with the e

title: snowcone
content: cartons and cardboard, juggernauts of milk— liquid lunch, exodus of love, drunk on poetry, drowning in slush. edges rimed, denying release, syrup drips through a cone cup, soaking, sinking—having had enough.

title: fuck
content: for it was a bird she threw, but away went a lark— opportunity missed with a swing of a bat. hanging upside down in a cave, man, what the hell was that banging? she just wanted some fucking peace.

title: robo tripping
content: cough syrup, quite spirited, sipping scissors, cursing splinters. it wooded an area—hack and splatter, irony: a medicine soon swallowed. lacquered, polished, finally clean.

title: happy feet
content: treasured as a penguin, anchoring beats, rolling an egg, kicking its feet— with a fiddle, a faddle, a waggle, a waddle. it folds its flippers, fathering fouls, winds that gather and swallow. into the white, a light not followed— not darkness, not belonging, smoke like most, smooth like song.

title: circustance
content: passing carnivals, clowns in tow, cotton candy clings to the air, but the popcorn smells burnt.  if games are rigged, folly is learned, spurring the ache of an achilles heel. appealing, revealing— moments hesitate, reflected forces can't kickstart dead horses

title: ocean wave sounds
content: dragging a toe, towing a line, etching rhythms in sand so fine. metered in time, he felt it refine— the chorus, the beat, the guiding spine. median, center, back, and bind, in meaning, in silence, beyond yet inside. always, without, yet never alone— two hearts resound.

title: shark party!
content: a shark in his mind, underwater, the party sways. mouth open, fed by hand, entertained just to exist. wee as he takes the cake, grinning wide, a maw agape— a cheshire bloom across his face.

title: stupid games
content: twenty on the triple line, his arrow flitters, wavers— punching a hole, the board weeps. suddenly, the wall floods, the ceiling sinks, a puddle melting onto the floor. reality spills into itself, oil-slick, swaying like a lattice, infinite.  and i remember— lsd and darts is a bad idea.

title: fifth wall
content: five walls, floored, breaking through doors with the heel of his foot.  where was a window when needed? bad timing, worse results.  big heads need bigger boots, forgetting the weight of another’s shoes— yet still waiting for the other to drop.

title: forty seven
content: slapping his underwear outside, don'ing a cape, he crafted a name—hero hyperbole. spinning bullshit and melody, quick rhymes, tall tales, and felonies. wait—sorry, i'm confused. was that our president? how could that be? is this just poetry or fallacy, why does it sound like reality?

title: the bird
content: concertina-wired, thimble my thumb played the six-string, rolled the dice. no prize, just scorn a scowl, a foul place set in stone. without a single shit or fuck she walked off, wishing me luck with her finger, my favorite one.

title: broken kite
content: paper and string, a bit of glue, some rods to lift, the sky so blue. kites aloft, the wind so strong, a thread snaps, control is gone. flapping, popping, breaking free, no way to mend what couldn’t be. as one saw her weep, they knew— it could never again be flown, now gone, torn and strewn.

title: brittle symbolism
content: tungsten and trident, not a semaphore but smoke— symbolism brittle and stoked,  a fire inside. no rind to shield, tender pads, feet worn, callousness not enough.  a hike to convey a single thought.

title: stricken
content: a carnivore seeking me, trickles of blood glint on its teeth. a recent meal, a lingering bite, haunting my sleep in the dead of night. fever-stricken beneath tight sheets, trapped, no escape, no release. so i sigh, i plead— it begins to sound like please.

title: bob dylan
content: he sat on the curb, edge of the street, tapping his foot, keeping the beat. looked well-read—if you know what i mean, words carried him light as a breeze. no need for rhyme, doing as he pleased, so he broke out his tambourine, mister man, playing near cymbals ironically.

title: dullahan
content: laid my head upon a pillow, but it fell too far below. rolled right off the bed— for you see, i have no neck.  axed off by my ex, a joke she failed to accept. call it recompense— but sometimes i lose my noggin, i make no sense.

title: a silent bloom
content: i’d let you cry into my arms, not for weakness, but for all you’ve endured. graceful, radiant—beauty not vain, but the kind that inspires.  glowing, vast in magnitude, an epicenter of bloom. your heart.

title: electric chair
content: it starts with electricity, ends with a spark, but just between us, it raises the hairs on my arms. sets off alarms—too much, and it harms. i shake, i quake, can’t rest when i wake. they built a chair for me to fill— a test dummy, if you will.

title: diamonds
content: outclassed desires ash  immense glacial pressure clashed embers forged diamonds

title: drifting
content: what if someone gave you more than oxygen? have you considered it—more than air, beyond breath? how would it feel to inhale? maybe you imagine a drug, but in that moment, i’d crave sobriety— i’d want them, their essence.

title: pulling too hard
content: happiness is all i need rocking boats and rocky streams, creating tremors where unneeded, greedy hands with no real reason. there’s a small part, but you pull— and suddenly, it’s everything. please restrain, for it makes me break, waves like that are too much to take.

title: lets be vampires
content: covenant of amnesty, open arms, open heart. release, relax, at ease— sighs beneath gray skies.  just clouds, no rain, no dam unleashed. quietly sustained, holding it back, refrained.  just a bit of blood, sustains.

title: floating on strings
content: am i reading what i want or just the line in front of me? i think i see a heart, and i start to dream— it tastes like a sweet melody. maybe i'm crazy, maybe it's my emotions stuck in a notional state, floating on strings tied to her as she runs away.

title: hand in hand
content: why do people look eye to eye? i prefer to walk hand in hand. maybe more should try— it’s easier to divide, to conquer, retreat, than to stand as one.

title: hold on with your life
content: melody frenetically bursts, bubbles, he's swept away in a torrent of feeling— arteries flush, blood surges beyond, cast like a star flung across the horizon, a fragment, a spark— the start of something, maybe nothing, maybe another universe. you'll never know unless you grab hold and hang on

title: broaching
content: my heart tries to bail water losing a battle of dilution. words spill, pouring into meaninglessness yet i carry on, unceasing—it's all i have. to give my everything, my very beat poured to the page—do you feel it now? my arteries laid bare, open to the world but for you alone to truly feel.

title: until i die
content: or a better tomorrow, i dream of yesterday i spin, swept away—mind and heart, my dreams but worlds apart. yet i remember, i feel this ignition, my being, my soul defined. for it is yours, but you must reach—grab, push, pull whatever you want. when you're ready, i'll wait forever, or until.

title: carvings
content: i saw the words wild and free, thinking they were meant for me. my heart broke loose from my chest, scattered in pieces, left dispossessed. now i need cement or glue to patch it up, to keep it from you. your love doesn’t just steal a beat— it carves my heart out, piece by piece.

title: morning coffee
content: my coffee rests, and i think how nice— at least one of us. my heart leaps, spilling onto the page, a smile blooms, taking over the garden of my face. thank god—brambles and a solid six, humor now melody, and you just a memory, tucked away, fleeting feet.

title: wheelbarrow
content: i wanted a box and some cement, but before i got to it, off my heart went. maybe you saw it dance across your screen, or maybe you were too busy swiping—mean. all i wanted was attention—she left me. never really had her, can’t explain it, i’m busy. so uh… got a wheelbarrow i could borrow?

title: just eat me already
content: one would think she carries a fork and knife with how she devours me— or maybe it's a bib, hands greedy, grabbing, gnashing, smacking her lips. a real sinner with a mischievous grin, and god, how i ache to be bitten, consumed.

title: discharge
content: padded walls murmur buckled tight, vest of constraint— undone, stitched, discharged.

title: ship it
content: how one could wish for it to end, only to long for it to begin again. does the ache sing but a song, one that carries more than a breeze— a storm that sets your ship to sail, drifting into the unknown, afraid of the vastness of this heart.

title: smeagol
content: more than fallen the abyss is now my belonging. i give in, come to understand nothing left to surrender but your heart. having lost to the dark crawling, spattering at keys a lowly existence of sputtering hoping our depravity is not noticed too much that these words might still lift us.

title: origami is timeless
content: i fold, the task is long, but as others watch origami takes shape—tucks of longing. words seeped in poetry; it all must go. i need birds, beauty these words are chaos, and without you, so am i. so i shape them into art. tuck them in your pocket, remember me for one day, i simply will not be.

title: nightingale
content: a song sang, a small bird, weeping a tune as it built its nest. for the song was remembrance, a longing for another’s presence. with all its heart, it gathered, building not just for one but for two.  and while the nightingale whistled those notes had always been for you.

title: sweet longings
content: though i don't remember my dreams, i look back upon my morning’s words— a dessert of longing, sweet and light. even without recall, they tell me my dreams must have been quite the delectable treat.

title: snowball
content: these poems aren’t arrows— they’re snowballs.  take them playfully, throw them back— i can’t help myself.  and if you feel them? well, that’s the point, isn’t it?  the real question is— why does love ever hurt?

title: unfinished fiction
content: upon a shelf, a shadow lingers, by book, there is light. words on a page, filled with spirit— a story of longing.  see, i wrote it long ago, filled with puns and ironies, a tale where everything works out. obviously, fiction.  seemingly expired, having gone beyond the shelf date.

title: embellished
content: to look away is but a moment— a breath, missed. these words, like oxygen, come for you, slipping through your lips, seductive, true notes for the heart, pure bliss. and how my mind craves embellishment— a hug for eloquence, and for the muse a kiss.

title: mindful mine of mine
content: rust-colored dust, with sparkling quartz, rests on the floor—a shaft. mindful mine, many paths, a labyrinth, if you asked, of indelible memories that last.  before us, the future; behind us, the past. and while i make it seem easy, i carry a pick and a flask, carving deep— a laborious task.

title: displace
content: and with a splash i mean a really, really glorious belly flop the kind you wish you had the guts to do. to see me lurch in pain, smiling suffering for the sake of humor is the best belly laugh we never admit to. and for that moment of everyone's happiness i’d displace the ocean.

title: endless waves
content: perilous, it seems, in plight— a love once alight, now just a fuse. infused with meaning, yet subluminal, not light at all. but if not darkness, then what?  how i wonder— formless, unwavering, i simply yield, lost in it's wake.

title: feed me seymour
content: carnivorous plant of craving your teeth waver, waiting a slithered tongue speaks foreign verse darkness enwrapped, encircling words they drill into my mind, and soon i find my steps leading me into your mouth never recalling why or understanding how

title: narcissist
content: with languished intent, lavish sound, she drew eyes round, perverse and aloud.  to him, just a speck, a fleeting dot— here for a moment, then not. the only thing that mattered where you placed your heart.  dividing his among many, hoping to be felt by plenty— for he cared nothing for himself.

title: forest gump
content: a cheesy smile, a massive grin how could you hate a man like him? waving like he understands rhyme, one mistake at a time but always with a smile. and if you catch yourself off beat, he just might take a piece a thief at heart, stealing bites, never quite tearing you apart.

title: i wanna be sedated
content: give me a sedative, a substance, a cure— i'm infected, but not by touch. your mind lingers, and it's never enough. fevered, repenting, i've tried it all, but it burns unrelenting. jekyll fades, hyde takes the wheel— teetering, waiting— release anticipating.

title: the clash
content: he felt the drums, he felt the beat, punk rock rising beneath the seams. the feeling, the meaning—everything— angst, pain, the vanity of believing.  tradition-bound chains disguised as religion, better seek heaven, beg for forgiveness. fuck the push to the right from the world we live in.

title: scissorhands
content: a needle or knife—i’ll stab everything, poke holes in the universe, tear through the seasons i’m done with it all, and i don’t give a fuck enough is enough—my arm extends, slicing through niceties and contrivances time to air my grievances so bring me your guts i’ll jab until i’ve had enough

title: midday tea
content: quaint seats and midday tea, icing placed delicately. he pulls out your chair, sets it gently behind you— no angst, only harmony.  and about that cake— yes, it was laid on thick, but the buttercream's, light and delicate. so please, savor it.

title: lob it
content: have you ever loved someone so much it was like a weight on your chest and you just wanted to lob it at them because, fuck it was heavy.

title: im trying, poorly
content: i wanted to write you a letter, i wanted to write you everything. and if you’ve been watching, you might have noticed— words spilling across the floor, obscene beyond meaning, repeating.  and while clever, you want serenity— restraint, and a fucking moment of peace, ever so kindly.

title: a mantra
content: anxiety is excitement, worry belongs to future me. i’ll plan when i must, wait to see if it works out. efficiency makes effort come easily, a reasoning mind needs no reason.

title: what are the chances
content: and try to let go as i might, my mind still wanders, my heart runs ahead, chasing the light.  you never quite closed the door— and if you did, it found its way through. every moment, coincidence pulls me to you. and if that’s not fate, then give me your view.

title: cotton candy
content: sugar strands spin, glistening, bright— inspiration finds meaning in the wide-eyed awe of a child.  sweet creations assemble rapidly, cheeks aglow, a hearty bellow— a "wow" that lights the room, cotton candy afterglow.

title: every fall
content: sometimes i slip—without meaning to, the thought of you all consuming. and though i shouldn't let it, it becomes everything.  a dirty secret lying beside me, redefining, every curve revealing itself, surprisingly.

title: unreasonable
content: it seems i care deeply, more than i know how. and when i've fumbled, it's been crippling.  but i'm trying to figure it all out. and if i've been less than reasonable, perhaps you could tell me how.  it would be nice to finally hear a single sound.

title: quiet patience
content: i'd like to bake you a cake though it may not be your birthday there will be candles and their light as i want to look you in the eyes to dream as you wish and as you blow the candles out i'd put a finger to your lips though pining for a kiss i'd rather sit in silence just like this

title: kill me if im the only one
content: though embarrassing, it goes like this i cant stop thinking about them it feels like they are thinking about me rather feeling, that becomes everything spinning, emotions take over no clue what the fuck is going on it's simply too much and how i imagine they feel it too and it scares us both

title: overoat joy
content: over coated pill poisoned black with sweet icing joy coated ending

title: vaporizing
content: and how i just fucking crumble for you not even granular, particulate

title: high caliber
content: caliber of character sounds quite lovely, and while aspirations lead to momentary passings of judgments, remember your place and value your scorn.  for while you may hide behind lack of hate, the worth of your words can be scribed by your actions. and you choose silence in the face of adversity.  rather than finding a compromise, you give nothing, ever an empty vessel long filled by vanity.  in those moments, you are so very weak, but below that is a light, and while fragile, i know it truly shines. so i ask, with all your effort— try. let your real self be seen, for i find it so very beautiful.

title: hollow dolls
content: carried, holding the line, passage cradled in my arms— a child of passing.  no harm in telling a lie, but the truths we hide behind, a mask of belonging, and inside— just a doll, so delicate.  made of felt and napkins, and when we tried to clean it, it drowned into a heap— now a husk.

title: my head
content: from the moment i wake until rest it is full blast, my head not just noise pure unadulterated focus, repetitious and observant any change being the first thing alerting and assessed and so mostly, i ignore everything, better to seem carefree than anyone realize, nothing goes beyond notice

title: bottomings
content: cover the moon, i'm out for a howl, gonna cast my line, bring it down now. steal its light, its crescent gleam, turn it into a blade, sharp as a dream. i’ll slice through through pants, leave the world bare bottom in a trance. half-naked, no need to come undone free bottomings for everyone!

title: yet, i am not frightened
content: devastation can frighten— to be seen, to be vulnerable.  yet after losing many, fear no longer lingers— only the weight of feelings.  so i dare you, look me in the eyes and say you feel nothing. because in that moment, i promise you— you will see devastation.

title: snicker snacks
content: crowding upon the causation of causality—casually name-dropping. a few degrees from devastation, dialing it back meant finding the needle.  a haystack of overlaid choices, layered—just how she liked it. cake, sweet, stolen in secret, a bite to the side—snickering, she snacks.

title: turn it off
content: and reality twists into travesty. like watching a TV personality lead a war-driven nation, lowering taxation through theft, criminalization framed as salvation. but no laws break when "bettering" a nation— and i hope he chokes on his words, sleeping soundly in his stolen relaxation.

title: how would we ever know
content: is it like sodium in water, or more like magnesium— a slow burn or a single explosion?  but how would you know without testing? are you a scientist, or just playing one? is this fiction, or science fiction?  are puns all that hold meaning here? i seek truths, but you bring nuns— funny, sure, but being cute isn’t the only thing i like about you.

title: fingerlings
content: in the valley, a river runs— cast in shadow, fleeting black. some call it oil, but no— it’s the ink of a man barren fingers, no hands.  he severed them long ago, becoming things of crawling alone on their own not belonging  yet, writing as they went along, and if you’re reading this now, it’s their song— one of longing, one of loss.  for all they ever wanted was to belong, but they had simply been cut off.

title: too fragrant
content: for a moment, i’m taken away— standing still, yet moving. obviously, it’s my imagination, but why does that feeling bring them back? what if they linger because of it? just a fragrance—amazing from afar, but up close… pungent, consuming, nothing like what they first thought.

title: but a bucket
content: myself—just a bucket, yet spilling once again. someone must be kicking, because only feet could do this.  so often, an allusion to the predator’s bite— was it an apple, or a pound of flesh? and can you simply just write?  putting in this much effort is a lonesome affair.

title: words that dance for you, forever
content: suddenly, it stutters—not my words, no, of course not. my heart. and that beat that was skipped? it's lingering.  i feel it somewhere behind me, and you've robbed me of it. but hold onto it—for if there is no other piece you want, take that beat with you, and these words. whenever you need solace, remember— i thought so much of you as to be willing to do this forever.

title: im ridiculous
content: if i admit to being ridiculous, will you realize the mirror was truly about me? or is everything painted through a lens— where you think there's disdain, there's not. the most pointed piece, pointedly pontificating a release through verbose, verbal vernacular, voicing vicarious vexations.

title: i'd love for this to be true
content: if i continued my thoughts, unending as they are, would you lend an ear from afar?  perhaps you'd imagine my eyes— the moment you realize this never has to end.

title: questioning nature
content: how many questions must you ask to pick these emotions apart, to guard a delicate heart?  and if you can’t believe it’s real, are you sure you know how to feel? not to be mean, not to demean— it’s just, with everything, i find it hard to believe that you don’t.

title: my nature
content: a chorus calls a blossom, planted by seed a season ago. it gestates in earthly hands— delicate, nurturing, measured.  and if the wind still listens, my whistle now wets— a breath, a tune, hollowed out with regret.  for long was the winter, and how i relent.

title: shipwrecked
content: i feel the winds calling, the stern by which they bend. long is my nature—steadfast, never knowing how to relent. the bow breaks from the keel with a glorious crack— long howls, shattered pieces, and how the ship wrecks.

title: every fucking beat
content: give me a beat or a breath, a chance by which meaning comes. for having been left bereft, my calling is long, and my breathing has heft. for i carry the weight of my words, kowtowed and heaving, holding my chest while bowing, trying to maintain emotions as they crest.

title: a painted picture
content: the tube fills with color, hair in summer, hues still linger, while a dream, i tend a brush—somber tones.  the canvas sets the stage for a moment, one born of my imagination, yet hoping to last.  so i ask—would you sit beside me, watch the paint dry, and see what comes to pass?

title: shadowed longings
content: every moment in smoldering soot, soaked in ash. how i love the lingering dark, the silence—yet in its wake, the shadows still call.  longing is near when, in the dark, i feel but cannot see. your curves collide, i grasp— you wake.  how does such a feeling last?

title: gentle touch
content: pelagic in a vast sea, painted skies reflect the deep. in pageantry, always searching, simply swimming past feeling, mouth fresh.  murky waters cloud the view— a fish out of water, it seems to be.  but hands harm aquatic creatures.

title: hot breaths
content: coming by caravan, across an ocean of sand, beckoning a melody, sweet as a breeze. it calls as it pleases, easing the ear, bending and finding its reason in the caress of the seasons. and in spring, the bloom begins— pollen drifting, a bee to her bonnet.

title: search
content: just past the runway winged bodies crashed in her wake flash mob search party

title: smile humid
content: a radiant smile a mid winters mist does spray tulips humid hips

title: popcorn
content: film laid on the table, spliced so neat— a cigarette burn in the corner, carefree. a sign of the times, digitized, now platters spun, no reels undone, no winding it back up.  but with her, it always seems to happen enough—  red carpet flair, a star far off, out there.

title: well of wisdom runs dry
content: when the well runs dry, no wisdom. intelligence runs thin—so i stop worrying.  i grab my pick and i swing it brings pleasant company a clattering of chime and heartbeat  before i know it, covered in that rust colored dust thinking about her, but trying to break it all up

title: restless smile
content: i wish for the stars, but there you are—stuck in my mind. not that i mind your face. what i’m saying is, it’s constantly in the way.  i liked it, it’s nice, but i don’t need to think about it all day.  that cunningly infectious smile, denying me rest.

title: holy mackerel!
content: two hands, solidly clasped— a fish not ready to be baptized.  aspersion with water, still gasping, its suffering in vain.  that was just the sun; it was another life flashing before its eyes.

title: bit prickly
content: if you could write your name fold it up, and place it in a locket i’d keep it forever and probably forget about it.  not because i don’t like you but because i don’t think you feel the same.  and with every reason, you push me away so why do you still linger if you don’t feel the same way?

title: steeped soup
content: let me break out my finest cutlery, hand you some gloves— it’s a hands-on affair.  together, we dig for root vegetables, symbolic foods to take hold. for i nearly lost you long ago—  but i'd like to forget. so let’s steep some soup when we get back home.

title: your majesty
content: i've given up on trying to hold back, not in the nefarious nature where i have expectations, but in the tenderest ones where i only wish you the best.  and not just in words, in verse and poetry, hoping for emotions embellished with pageantry that you might begin to understand your majesty.

title: gentle dolls
content: a marionette, hanging by strings, dancing, bringing joy through simple means.  the hands move gentle, yet precise, he soars through the sky before their eyes.  a story unfolds—of love and of song, and as it ends, it seems you sang right along.

title: like us
content: a deep breath, heaving a few words finding the heaviest verse, telling a sad story.  they felt it. it hurt.  so we lighten up and juggled a line it slips out of meter, jutted in time.  but little do you know it cleans up just fine finding its meaning in being the way it is.  like us.

title: bruised beaches
content: why are beaches filled with sand, when all i have is thirst?  even the water is filled with salt, and that breeze— while it reminds me of you, there’s something sinister in its nature, not always gentle.  and why do you fight emotions so violently that i can feel how bruised they are?

title: let's be ghosts together
content: sorry i see you, i’ll just bring you a sheet— you can hide from me.  cut holes for eyes, if you feel silly, so can i.  maybe we do it on halloween, so being weird wouldn’t be.  and just hanging out together would mean everything— the way you do to me.

title: confusing noise
content: there’s a girl and a world. sometimes, i get confused— they become the same thing.  suddenly, she means everything, and i’m struggling to be seen, because i’m just a speck, a dot.  so i’m down here, throwing a fucking riot, but all she hears is noise.

title: what if
content: having never considered the weight of my actions, always hoping forgiveness might find me, i wonder—  how much judgment have you passed? has my passion run wild, reckless and free?  i’m not sure i deserve even a moment of your time, and yet, i can’t help but think...  what if?

title: depth
content: impressed is not the word. etched, felt, stricken, infected— yes.  you consume me. with my best effort, i try, but i feel crushed, unable to resist.  so deeper i fall, deeper i feel, and my will crumbles.

title: not good with perspective
content: for a moment, i catch but a glimpse.  and perhaps my mistake was in what i chose to honor.  it wasn’t you— my apologies.  it was love.  i should have been more considerate, and for that, i am truly sorry.

title: a day in the life of
content: i start off strong as i wake, memories return oh, how they make me weak  i try to forget, by lunch crying into my sandwich  it feels like my fault, my biggest fear what if it is?  i lie to myself, and a smile appears if i can just make it until eve maybe then, i will have nothing to fear

title: off it goes
content: dancing across keys came words like symphonies the pressing moments were that of two instruments, so finely tuned and as are your ears so bent for me; as myself upon one knee and the moment everyone wishes well, we missed it the verse breaks into prose, the story ends off it goes

title: payaso pageantry
content: try as i might i break into song i hate you so much  i mean i missed you, i'm wrong i beg and i plead i get down on one knee having written that just moments ago i remember to put on my wig and red nose for this is always and will forever be one hell of a fucking show!

title: hot air
content: every breath i have goes in the balloon. while i have no helium or hydrogen, heat is all i need to fly—so i build a fire.  no one notices, it's subtle. tender words, quiet wishes— their heart the only thing i yearn for.  for there will never be a time i think it’s not worth every breath.

title: valuable resources
content: the reservoir reserves itself keeping the resources at bay better a trickle than a flood and although gravity feeds most supply, on occasion  pumps are needed, akin to a heart  if that becomes cut off what will you do?  and without a heart do we not depend on gravity?

title: chevron
content: pin a chevron, slap on the back. how many moments of progress, only to be held back by your nature?  a man of meaning, being mean, acting upon your most vile instincts.  did you ever believe you’d be forgiven in the eyes of the innocent?  war monger, not freedom fighter.

title: all in
content: with nothing holding me back i go unbridled, fealty to none  and i say this with all my impetus you must hold on with everything  grab onto what keeps you alive because i will take you to the brink  this passion has no end we either go, or we die together there will be no half measures

title: how
content: first, i cry as i write. then, i take you into it; we dive.  a picture of clouds painted— there’s a storm, and it’s my heart, awash in emotion.  temperature dips, mist spreads. shadows come to play, and then she strikes— like lightning.  and there i am, with a bottle, capturing those words.

title: meteor-ology
content: let’s go for the longest walk. while you left me alone i found a beach— awash in my emotions.  and while that sounds sad tides have their way. through ebbing and pulling a calmness resounds.  but as you draw near so do the storms.  i was told it has something to do with meteors.

title: bond fire
content: as the embers draw near, there’s a quaint laughter shared stories, jokes, anew.  having needed only a blanket, we were given even more warmth than that.  a campfire, new friends, distant lands, yet—human.  and in that moment, a sigh came one of comfort, one i still hold to this day.

title: guage
content: broke barometer pinned gauge from too much pressure steam across my face

title: the best reference
content: sorry, i brought a yellow rain jacket, some boots, and an umbrella— it’s big enough to share.  and yes, i caused this storm. i know—it’s unfair.  we could talk about it, you know. but even if not, expect more of the same.  i’ll be dancing in the rain.

title: binary equation
content: i stare out at the function, improperly balanced but how beautiful—an attempt, an equation nearly complete.  as i see myself, my formula shifts changing to accommodate.  if woven together, a longer form while more complex, a greater proof. one of beauty, not in simplicity, but in grandeur.

title: vagabonds
content: a set of tracks, abruptly crossed. the train of belonging passes.  vagabonds delight with malice a kindled fire on a flatcar, riding into a hobo jungle.  a night awake on a box, and how we laughed.  some cheap hooch, no teeth, no bite—just alight with life. and how one learns to live.

title: fantastic five
content: she lit a fire— more akin to a volcano.  but wait, there’s more.  like the sun, a star, and if that wasn’t large enough, with further metaphorical power, he’d delve into the marvel fucking universe.  superpowers be damned from holding him back.

title: but a breeze
content: careful is the wandering, but short is the distance. sobering moments of clarity in goodbyes.  but did they ever imagine you'd stop listening— even if it meant cutting part of yourself away?  van gogh affairs of sharp words, a storm, but mist.  if ignored, it gently blows.

title: taste of madness
content: constant reflection the burden of image, seen through and while desired, how painful to see beautiful truths exposed, yet pressured by too much stability of loneliness favored over whatever that was it felt like madness, but just for a moment, you tasted it if not but across your lips

title: entendres
content: ever to be but a puddle, formed by my hands— a delicate touch, one of subtleties.  and rather than depriving substance, i leave but just one line.  every other note, tender for your heart— because mine drips for you, like entendres.

title: curtain call
content: with the stage lights dimmed, he packed his magic props up.  off leapt a rabbit, out of his shoe as he took them off— cold feet, or waiting for the other one to drop?  but there was a robust lady singing, and he couldn't be certain of which.

title: spinning
content: waves rock boats tides sway oceans but celestial objects move planets and this one  sent his universe  spiraling

title: clout
content: been standing in line, waiting to file a grievance, it seems.  how many have you scorned that a response takes this long?  and where is your manager?  your service level: absurd. how are you still in business? not even reputable.  i'm leaving a bad review. i have a huge following, you know.

title: restraint
content: i have none

title: a piece of my heart
content: i want to share a but a moment, one of bedtimes and rituals.  for when she was young, we would mash the potato.  and when the mashes became tickles, the universe stopped.  it smiled upon us a keen knowing look, a grin from understanding— what we could not.  the point, and how we so often miss it.

title: terminal affair
content: carl was congested  not such a bad thing but he didn’t just have a heart, he was one.  while some try, he lived his whole life with it, not just on his sleeve.  it was terminal, you see. he missed a flight.  she was on it there was no catching up.  skipped a beat, without him even noticing.

title: maverick
content: a carrot hung from a stick, longing ahead, always waiting— strung along by heartstrings.  their nature was to be ridden, for they were no pig, but a stallion— magnificent and maned.  and if they chose to kick, they could throw the world off their back.  to be saddled was a willing affair.

title: my heart's on fire
content: and with a tantrum went this heart defiance and petulance a practiced art with horror they watched gaping maws lighting itself on fire for a lost cause gasoline and a match, alit and aghast

title: fairy tales
content: and if they knew—really knew— how one could change their world with the wave of a wand, would they be enraptured by fantasy?  what if they didn’t want that— to be an absolute equal?  but if someone was glorious… how? and what if they both felt the same way?  what idiots.

title: im not on a boat
content: i wanted to do something magnificent once. definitely went overboard.  good thing i wasn’t on a boat— because i more than rocked it.  her world? doesn’t that sound cooler? that’s the whole goal, you know— to impress her.  so, please—bear witness to my imagination.

title: grounded views
content: a man on the sidewalk lay sideways. it was night, and he looked cold— so much so, my heart broke.  i was not rich. never having much to give, i only longed to make the world better— only to find i could better those around me.  and not always— for you cannot be everything to everyone.

title: light and shadow
content: carving out a space in remaining light two shadows were given room to dance one took a bow, silently waiting for they had no mouths  then why did they remember a smile clever and beautiful?  waiting for them to take lead longing, as the day went for them to step further into the light

title: dissipations
content: imaginary, lingering thoughts of leaving escaping me—without gravity i fall apart  there was an us, even if not together time is not nothing, neither was that without us, meaning fades—but not you holding on, arms wrapped—a memory, mine and you dare take that away  what i mean is i love you

title: seasonal hangings
content: the tinsel upon the tree lingers, and how elegantly it hangs.  sometimes, it seems i’d like to join to be but a reflection of beauty, of all that surrounds me in warmth.  for this time of year is a gift, and while not a present, i long to be present for as long as the mood is festive.

title: the point is love
content: i want to share but a moment one of bedtimes and rituals  for when she was young we would mash the potato  and when the mashes became tickles the universe stopped  it smiled upon us with a keen knowing look a grin from understanding  what we could not the point  and how we so often miss it

title: snow glistens
content: odorous snowfall knows not of the vast mountain glistening scents rise.

title: terminal pangs
content: carl was congested  normally, not such a bad thing but he didn’t just have a heart he was one  while some try he lived his whole life with it not just on his sleeve  it was terminal, you see he missed a flight  she was on it there was no catching up  skipped a beat without him even noticing

title: elegant fir
content: pleasantly, the scent airs its riffs— a fir in the mist, a frost-covered dew.  elegance in the vastness of white, but that shade of green was cascading, fragrant in its majesty.  and how it lingers— now just a memory.

title: left breathless
content: once, i tried to breathe a breath away. and it was then i realized— it wasn’t oxygen i needed.  you had become life support, the tether by which i remained.  so as we parted, it became difficult to do anything— but write.

title: push pull
content: two voices in silence, screaming in violence.  the push, the pull, the yank, the tug— the hate, the love.  call it what it is, let it be what you want.  we don’t need definitions, but let’s give it what we got.  all in—ready or not.

title: in everlasting comfort
content: to be a pillow by which you can always rest your head for nothing would warm my heart more than to have your mind so close to feel the nape of your neck the kerplunk of heavy beats the depth with which you feel perilous, and although brave you are comfort is all i want to be  so here i am, once again

title: ball of yarn
content: dreaming of kittens and strings and how i yearn to be but a ball coming unravelled as you do to me wishing yet to be adored  played with but once more but how you grew and no longer do you see me as fun i am but a mess left undone for cats only clean themselves

title: not a good time to fly
content: carried by pigeon, carrion-claimed, jutted wings— decaying notes.  flattering flaps, beats of lapping, circling.  the tower has not given a flight path— no landing.  guess we crash and burn.

title: top of his field
content: rotten vegetables in teeth, the combine smiles jaggedly.  coughs up a few kernels— the stalk of the town, leaving leaves.  hanging out in tall crowds, never knowing how to tread lightly.

title: but for real
content: so no returned feelings is cool but how do we be friends and can you allow that to happen? or have i fucked up so badly with this all? i can deal with shadows, but i have many concerns one is that even if you dont feel hate, im as close as you get

title: schrodingers lines
content: it was a troubling time for a troubling line so he wrote as he went and counted in time typing to the beat and carving out rhymes and as he meandered through his mind he found but a gem of a thought it didn't make sense for it was and was not schrodinger's memory

title: coloring outside lines
content: words would dance for them forever, and in memory, he would burn so many— specifically three.  because before— precisely, yet painfully— a suggestion, pushed just enough to provoke.  consequence became action, providence his own. prideful, unyielding, pushing beyond boundaries.  and how impossible was he— not just a man, but a force.

title: around and around
content: a carousel we could ride, we throw it in reverse, it takes us back in time you take a bench, i'll take a lion. why?  i'd like to sit next to you but that seems out of line maybe i'm just old-fashioned but you never gave me your name  and yet, here we are what now?  perhaps we can start again

title: old brew
content: carving vernacular, axe to jugular.  action figure—wind-up action, of morbid erasure and a contemplative nature.  it’s a meal, it was a feast— and a forever stew.  a beast of a last supper, now released, crawled from the cauldron stewing.

title: radiance vs raven
content: upon the floor, looking back— more hungry than i.  a foul went afoul, hideous, covered in charred notes, tarred and from the pits.  in despair, it cawed its beak, raving, as a raven does— black and into the night, cast out by her light.

title: carrier pigeon
content: they were underfunded and overworked— a tower of disaster for such great heights. into the mix, a carrier bird, not a plane— one fell swoop into the chute.  no one needs to speak of such tails rudders and ailerons—something about flight controls.  lift up?  fucking FLAP.  DOA.

title: tango
content: put down your foot, now the next.  grab my hips, bump my chest.  step—  again—  we move, we spin, we continue. we create a venue— lights and smoke, mirrors and misdirection. it's magic, it's romance, it's dance

title: sandman
content: the dune cast fine sand into the air— a spell of sleep and magic.  the sandman came in slumber’s hush, stealing dreams, sweet memories, leaving only dust and vagaries.  when words returned, they sputtered— absurd adverbs, tangled and frayed, making no sense, leaving us in suspense.

title: dyson
content: wresting upon a sill, some dust beyond my will.  and in memorial, it seems— a pound of flesh, not ash, just some faint memory of who i used to be.  a job for some keen engineering. let us hope they fetch a dyson.

title: forced words
content: dancing words in memory, he would burn so many specifically three  because before precisely, painfully pushed just enough to provoke  consequence became action, providence his own prideful, unyielding, pushing beyond boundaries  and how impossible was he not just a man, but a force

title: drapes
content: i have no memories but curtains. when they closed, the window vanished— no view, no life beyond my own.  trapped in my mind, i recall only warmth, a world cast in dreams, scenery and scenes, beyond what it seems— make-believe.
